member.summary: Creates response for the specified request.

member.summary: Creates response for the specified request.
member.param: Data flow what sends response. This value is used to construct Contact: header value. This value can be null, but then adding Contact: header is response sender responsibility.
member.exception: Is raised when statusCode_reasonText or request is null reference.
Is raised when request is ACK-request. ACK request is response less.

member.name: E:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Stack.ValidateRequest
member.summary: This event is raised when new incoming SIP request is received. You can control incoming requests with that event. For example you can require authentication or send what ever error to request maker user.

member.name: E:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Stack.RequestReceived
member.summary: This event is raised when new SIP request is received.

member.name: E:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Stack.ResponseReceived
member.summary: This event is raised when new stray SIP response is received. Stray response means that response doesn't match to any transaction.

member.name: E:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Stack.Error
member.summary: This event is raised by any SIP element when unknown/unhandled error happened.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription
member.summary: This class represents SDP media description. Defined in RFC 4566 5.14.

member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: SDP media type. List of knwon values .
Media formats. See MediaFormats property for more info.
member.exception: Is raised when mediaType or protocol is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

member.summary: Internal parse constructor.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses media from "m" SDP message field.

member.summary: Sets SDP media stream mode.
member.exception: Is raised when streamMode is null reference.

member.summary: Converts this to valid media string.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets meadia type. Currently defined media are "audio", "video", "text", "application", and "message", although this list may be extended in the future.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the transport port to which the media stream is sent.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.NumberOfPorts
member.summary: Gets or sets number of continuos media ports.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.Protocol
member.summary: Gets or sets transport protocol. Currently known protocols: UDP;RTP/AVP;RTP/SAVP.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.MediaFormats
member.summary: Gets media formats collection.

remarks.code: ; Media Formats: ; If the Transport Protocol is "RTP/AVP" or "RTP/SAVP" the <fmt> ; sub-fields contain RTP payload type numbers, for example: ; - for Audio: 0: PCMU, 4: G723, 8: PCMA, 18: G729 ; - for Video: 31: H261, 32: MPV ; If the Transport Protocol is "udp" the <fmt> sub-fields ; must reference a MIME type

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.Information
member.summary: Gets or sets media information. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.Connection
member.summary: Gets or sets per media connection data. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.Bandwidth
member.summary: Gets or sets bandwidth data. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.Attributes
member.summary: Gets media attributes collection.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SDP.SDP_MediaDescription.Tags
member.summary: Gets user data items collection.

member.summary: Gets direct access to header.

member.summary: Gets or sets what features end point supports.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AcceptContact
member.summary: Gets or sets Accept-Contact header value. Defined in RFC 3841.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AcceptEncoding
member.summary: Gets encodings what end point supports. Example: Accept-Encoding: gzip.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AcceptLanguage
member.summary: Gets preferred languages for reason phrases, session descriptions, or status responses carried as message bodies in the response. If no Accept-Language header field is present, the server SHOULD assume all languages are acceptable to the client.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AcceptResourcePriority
member.summary: Gets Accept-Resource-Priority headers. Defined in RFC 4412.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AlertInfo
member.summary: Gets AlertInfo values collection. When present in an INVITE request, the Alert-Info header field specifies an alternative ring tone to the UAS. When present in a 180 (Ringing) response, the Alert-Info header field specifies an alternative ringback tone to the UAC.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Allow
member.summary: Gets methods collection which is supported by the UA which generated the message.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AllowEvents
member.summary: Gets Allow-Events header which indicates the event packages supported by the client. Defined in rfc 3265.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AuthenticationInfo
member.summary: Gets the Authentication-Info header fields which provides for mutual authentication with HTTP Digest.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Authorization
member.summary: Gets the Authorization header fields which contains authentication credentials of a UA.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.CallID
member.summary: Gets or sets the Call-ID header field which uniquely identifies a particular invitation or all registrations of a particular client. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.CallInfo
member.summary: Gets the Call-Info header field which provides additional information about the caller or callee, depending on whether it is found in a request or response.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Contact
member.summary: Gets contact header fields. The Contact header field provides a SIP or SIPS URI that can be used to contact that specific instance of the UA for subsequent requests.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets the Content-Disposition header field which describes how the message body or, for multipart messages, a message body part is to be interpreted by the UAC or UAS. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Gets the Content-Encodings which is used as a modifier to the "media-type". When present, its value indicates what additional content codings have been applied to the entity-body, and thus what decoding mechanisms MUST be applied in order to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Gets content languages.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentLength
member.summary: Gets SIP request content data size in bytes.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the Content-Type header field which indicates the media type of the message-body sent to the recipient. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.CSeq
member.summary: Gets or sets command sequence number and the request method. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets date and time. Value DateTime.MinValue means that value not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ErrorInfo
member.summary: Gets the Error-Info header field which provides a pointer to additional information about the error status response.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Event
member.summary: Gets or sets Event header. Defined in RFC 3265.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Expires
member.summary: Gets or sets relative time after which the message (or content) expires. Value -1 means that value not specified.

member.summary: Gets or sets initiator of the request. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.HistoryInfo
member.summary: Gets History-Info headers. Defined in RFC 4244.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Identity
member.summary: Identity header value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4474.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.IdentityInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets Identity-Info header value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4474.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.InReplyTo
member.summary: Gets the In-Reply-To header fields which enumerates the Call-IDs that this call references or returns.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Join
member.summary: Gets or sets Join header which indicates that a new dialog (created by the INVITE in which the Join header field in contained) should be joined with a dialog identified by the header field, and any associated dialogs or conferences. Defined in 3911. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.MaxForwards
member.summary: Gets or sets limit the number of proxies or gateways that can forward the request to the next downstream server. Value -1 means that value not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.MimeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets mime version. Currently 1.0 is only defined value. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Organization
member.summary: Gets or sets organization name which the SIP element issuing the request or response belongs. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Path
member.summary: Gets an Path header. It is used in conjunction with SIP REGISTER requests and with 200 class messages in response to REGISTER (REGISTER responses). Defined in rfc 3327.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Priority
member.summary: Gest or sets priority that the SIP request should have to the receiving human or its agent. Value null means not specified.

member.summary: Gets an proxy authentication challenge.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ProxyAuthorization

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ProxyRequire

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.RAck

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Reason

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.RecordRoute

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.Mime
member.summary: Class for creating,parsing,modifing rfc 2822 mime messages.

remarks.code:
Message examples:
Simple message:
//--- Beginning of message From: sender@domain.com To: recipient@domain.com Subject: Message subject. Content-Type: text/plain
Message body text. Bla blaa blaa,blaa. //--- End of message
In simple message MainEntity is whole message.
Message with attachments:
//--- Beginning of message From: sender@domain.com To: recipient@domain.com Subject: Message subject. Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="multipart_mixed"
--multipart_mixed /* text entity */ Content-Type: text/plain
Message body text. Bla blaa blaa,blaa. --multipart_mixed /* attachment entity */ Content-Type: application/octet-stream
attachment_data --multipart_mixed-- //--- End of message
MainEntity is multipart_mixed entity and text and attachment entities are child entities of MainEntity.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Flow
member.summary: Implements SIP Flow. Defined in draft-ietf-sip-outbound.
member.remarks: A Flow is a network protocol layer (layer 4) association between two hosts that is represented by the network address and port number of both ends and by the protocol. For TCP, a flow is equivalent to a TCP connection. For UDP a flow is a bidirectional stream of datagrams between a single pair of IP addresses and ports of both peers.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTP_Source_Remote
member.summary: This class represents RTP remote source what we receive.
member.remarks: Source indicates an entity sending packets, either RTP and/or RTCP. Sources what send RTP packets are called "active", only RTCP sending ones are "passive".

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTP_Source
member.summary: This class represents RTP source.
member.remarks: Source indicates an entity sending packets, either RTP and/or RTCP. Sources what send RTP packets are called "active", only RTCP sending ones are "passive". Source can be local(we send RTP and/or RTCP remote party) or remote(remote party sends RTP and/or RTCP to us).

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentType
member.summary: Represents "Content-Type:" header. Defined in RFC 2045 5.1.

remarks.code:
RFC 2045 5.1. In the Augmented BNF notation of RFC 822, a Content-Type header field value is defined as follows:
content := "Content-Type" ":" type "/" subtype *(";" parameter) ; Matching of media type and subtype ; is ALWAYS case-insensitive.
type := discrete-type / composite-type
discrete-type := "text" / "image" / "audio" / "video" / "application" / extension-token
composite-type := "message" / "multipart" / extension-token
extension-token := ietf-token / x-token
ietf-token := (An extension token defined by a standards-track RFC and registered with IANA.)
x-token := (The two characters "X-" or "x-" followed, with no intervening white space, by any token)
subtype := extension-token / iana-token
iana-token := (A publicly-defined extension token. Tokens of this form must be registered with IANA as specified in RFC 2048.)
parameter := attribute "=" value
attribute := token ; Matching of attributes ; is ALWAYS case-insensitive.
value := token / quoted-string
token := 1*(any (US-ASCII) CHAR except SPACE, CTLs,or tspecials)
tspecials := "(" / ")" / "<" / ">" / "@" / "," / ";" / ":" / "\" / " "/" / "[" / "]" / "?" / "=" ; Must be in quoted-string, ; to use within parameter values

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_b_MultipartAlternative
member.summary: This class represents MIME multipart/alternative body. Defined in RFC 2046 5.1.4.
member.remarks: The "multipart/alternative" is intended for use when each of the body parts is an "alternative" version of the same information. In general, user agents that compose "multipart/alternative" entities must place the body parts in increasing order of preference, that is, with the preferred format last.

member.summary: This class represents MIME application/xxx bodies. Defined in RFC 2046 5.1.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_b_MessageDeliveryStatus
member.summary: This class represents MIME message/delivery-status body. Defined in RFC 3464.

remarks.code:
delivery-status-content = per-message-fields 1*( CRLF per-recipient-fields )
per-message-fields = [ original-envelope-id-field CRLF ] reporting-mta-field CRLF [ dsn-gateway-field CRLF ] [ received-from-mta-field CRLF ] [ arrival-date-field CRLF ] *( extension-field CRLF )
per-recipient-fields = [ original-recipient-field CRLF ] final-recipient-field CRLF action-field CRLF status-field CRLF [ remote-mta-field CRLF ] [ diagnostic-code-field CRLF ] [ last-attempt-date-field CRLF ] [ final-log-id-field CRLF ] [ will-retry-until-field CRLF ] *( extension-field CRLF )

member.summary: Gets or sets a server-specified unique data string. It is recommended that this string be base64 or hexadecimal data. Suggested value: base64(time-stamp hex(time-stamp ":" ETag ":" private-key)).
member.exception: Is raised when invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Opaque
member.summary: Gets or sets string of data, specified by the server, which should be returned by the client unchanged. It is recommended that this string be base64 or hexadecimal data.
member.exception: Is raised when invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets algorithm to use to produce the digest and a checksum. This is normally MD5 or MD5-sess.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Response
member.summary: Gets a string of 32 hex digits computed by HTTP digest algorithm, which proves that the user knows a password.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.UserName
member.summary: Gets or sets user name.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets password.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Uri
member.summary: Gets the URI from Request-URI.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Qop
member.summary: Gets or sets value what indicates "quality of protection" the client has applied to the message. If present, its value MUST be one of the alternatives the server indicated it supports in the WWW-Authenticate header. This directive is optional in order to preserve backward compatibility.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.CNonce
member.summary: Gets or sets Client nonce value. This MUST be specified if a qop directive is sent (see above), and MUST NOT be specified if the server did not send a qop directive in the WWW-Authenticate header field.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.NonceCount
member.summary: Gets or stets nonce count. This MUST be specified if a qop directive is sent (see above), and MUST NOT be specified if the server did not send a qop directive in the WWW-Authenticate header field. The nc-value is the hexadecimal count of the number of requests.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ForkingMode
member.summary: This enum specifies SIP proxy server 'forking' mode.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ForkingMode.None
member.summary: No forking. The contact with highest q value is used.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ForkingMode.Parallel
member.summary: All contacts are processed parallel at same time.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ForkingMode.Sequential
member.summary: In a sequential search, a proxy server attempts each contact address in sequence, proceeding to the next one only after the previous has generated a final response. Contacts are processed from highest q value to lower.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState
member.summary: Implements SIP "Subscription-State" value. Defined in RFC 3265.

remarks.code: RFC 3265 Syntax: Subscription-State = substate-value *( SEMI subexp-params ) substate-value = "active" / "pending" / "terminated" / extension-substate extension-substate = token subexp-params = ("reason" EQUAL event-reason-value) / ("expires" EQUAL delta-seconds) / ("retry-after" EQUAL delta-seconds) / generic-param event-reason-value = "deactivated" / "probation" / "rejected" / "timeout" / "giveup" / "noresource" / event-reason-extension event-reason-extension = token

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
member.summary: This class holds 'substate-value' values.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.active
member.summary: The subscription has been accepted and (in general) has been authorized.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.pending
member.summary: The subscription has been received by the notifier, but there is insufficient policy information to grant or deny the subscription yet.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.terminated
member.summary: The subscriber should consider the subscription terminated.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason
member.summary: This class holds 'event-reason-value' values.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.deactivated
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated, but the subscriber SHOULD retry immediately with a new subscription. One primary use of such a status code is to allow migration of subscriptions between nodes. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "deactivated".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.probation
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated, but the client SHOULD retry at some later time. If a "retry-after" parameter is also present, the client SHOULD wait at least the number of seconds specified by that parameter before attempting to re-subscribe.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.rejected
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated due to change in authorization policy. Clients SHOULD NOT attempt to re-subscribe. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "rejected".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.timeout
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because it was not refreshed before it expired. Clients MAY re-subscribe immediately. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "timeout".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.giveup
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because the notifier could not obtain authorization in a timely fashion. If a "retry-after" parameter is also present, the client SHOULD wait at least the number of seconds specified by that parameter before attempting to re-subscribe; otherwise, the client MAY retry immediately, but will likely get put back into pending state.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.noresource
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because the resource state which was being monitored no longer exists. Clients SHOULD NOT attempt to re-subscribe. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "noresource".

member.summary: Gets or sets directive.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType
member.summary: Proccess directives. Defined in rfc 3841 9.1.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Proxy
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each server to proxy request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Redirect
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each server to redirect request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Cancel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each proxy server to send a CANCEL request to forked branches.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoCancel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would NOT want each proxy server to send a CANCEL request to forked branches.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Fork
member.summary: This type of directive indicates whether a proxy should fork a request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoFork
member.summary: This type of directive indicates whether a proxy should proxy to only a single address. The server SHOULD proxy the request to the "best" address (generally the one with the highest q-value).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Recurse
member.summary: This directive indicates whether a proxy server receiving a 3xx response should send requests to the addresses listed in the response.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoRecurse
member.summary: This directive indicates whether a proxy server receiving a 3xx response should forward the list of addresses upstream towards the caller.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Parallel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like the proxy server to proxy the request to all known addresses at once.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Sequential
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like the proxy server to go through all known addresses sequentially, contacting the next address only after it has received a non-2xx or non-6xx final response for the previous one.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Queue
member.summary: This directive indicates whether if the called party is temporarily unreachable, caller wants to have its call queued.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoQueue
member.summary: This directive indicates whether if the called party is temporarily unreachable, caller don't want its call to be queued.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_CSeq
member.summary: Implements SIP "Cseq" value. Defined in RFC 3261. A CSeq in a request contains a single decimal sequence number and the request method. The method part of CSeq is case-sensitive. The CSeq header field serves to order transactions within a dialog, to provide a means to uniquely identify transactions, and to differentiate between new requests and request retransmissions.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: CSeq = 1*DIGIT LWS Method

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutClose(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Closes the specified waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device. If the function succeeds, the handle is no longer valid after this call.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutGetDevCaps(System.UInt32,LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEOUTCAPS@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Queries a specified waveform device to determine its capabilities.
member.param: Identifier of the waveform-audio output device. It can be either a device identifier or a Handle to an open waveform-audio output device.
Pointer to a WAVEOUTCAPS structure to be filled with information about the capabilities of the device.
Size, in bytes, of the WAVEOUTCAPS structure.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutGetNumDevs
member.summary: Retrieves the number of waveform output devices present in the system.
member.returns: The number of devices indicates success. Zero indicates that no devices are present or that an error occurred.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutGetPosition(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the current playback position of the specified waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.
Size, in bytes, of the MMTIME structure.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutGetVolume(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Queries the current volume setting of a waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to an open waveform-audio output device. This parameter can also be a device identifier.

Pointer to a variable to be filled with the current volume setting. The low-order word of this location contains the left-channel volume setting, and the high-order word contains the right-channel setting. A value of 0xFFFF represents full volume, and a value of 0x0000 is silence.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutOpen(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX,LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.waveOutProc,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The waveOutOpen function opens the given waveform-audio output device for playback.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives a handle identifying the open waveform-audio output device. Use the handle to identify the device when calling other waveform-audio output functions. This parameter might be NULL if the WAVE_FORMAT_QUERY flag is specified for fdwOpen.
Identifier of the waveform-audio output device to open. It can be either a device identifier or a handle of an open waveform-audio input device.
Pointer to a WAVEFORMATEX structure that identifies the format of the waveform-audio data to be sent to the device. You can free this structure immediately after passing it to waveOutOpen.

Pointer to a fixed callback function, an event handle, a handle to a window, or the identifier of a thread to be called during waveform-audio playback to process messages related to the progress of the playback. If no callback function is required, this value can be zero.
User-instance data passed to the callback mechanism.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutPause(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Pauses playback on a specified waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutPrepareHeader(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Prepares a waveform data block for playback.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.
Pointer to a WAVEHDR structure that identifies the data block to be prepared. The buffer's base address must be aligned with the respect to the sample size.
Size, in bytes, of the WAVEHDR structure.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutReset(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Stops playback on a specified waveform output device and resets the current position to 0.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutRestart(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Restarts a paused waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutSetVolume(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the volume of a waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to an open waveform-audio output device. This parameter can also be a device identifier.

Specifies a new volume setting. The low-order word contains the left-channel volume setting, and the high-order word contains the right-channel setting. A value of 0xFFFF represents full volume, and a value of 0x0000 is silence.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutUnprepareHeader(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Cleans up the preparation performed by waveOutPrepareHeader.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.
Pointer to a WAVEHDR structure identifying the data block to be cleaned up.
Size, in bytes, of the WAVEHDR structure.

member.summary: Sends a data block to the specified waveform output device.

Pointer to a WAVEHDR structure containing information about the data block.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX
member.summary: This class represents WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.wFormatTag
member.summary: Waveform-audio format type. Format tags are registered with Microsoft Corporation for many compression algorithms. A complete list of format tags can be found in the Mmreg.h header file. For one- or two-channel PCM data, this value should be WAVE_FORMAT_PCM. When this structure is included in a WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE structure, this value must be WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.nChannels
member.summary: Number of channels in the waveform-audio data. Monaural data uses one channel and stereo data uses two channels.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.nSamplesPerSec
member.summary: Sample rate, in samples per second (hertz). If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, then common values for nSamplesPerSec are 8.0 kHz, 11.025 kHz, 22.05 kHz, and 44.1 kHz.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.nAvgBytesPerSec
member.summary: Required average data-transfer rate, in bytes per second, for the format tag. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, nAvgBytesPerSec should be equal to the product of nSamplesPerSec and nBlockAlign.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.nBlockAlign
member.summary: Block alignment, in bytes. The block alignment is the minimum atomic unit of data for the wFormatTag format type. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM or WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE, nBlockAlign must be equal to the product of nChannels and wBitsPerSample divided by 8 (bits per byte).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.wBitsPerSample
member.summary: Bits per sample for the wFormatTag format type. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, then wBitsPerSample should be equal to 8 or 16.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.cbSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of extra format information appended to the end of the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.summary: This class represents WAVEHDR structure.

member.summary: Long pointer to the address of the waveform buffer.

member.summary: Specifies the length, in bytes, of the buffer.

member.summary: When the header is used in input, this member specifies how much data is in the buffer. When the header is used in output, this member specifies the number of bytes played from the buffer.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.dwUser
member.summary: Specifies user data.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.dwFlags
member.summary: Specifies information about the buffer.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.dwLoops
member.summary: Specifies the number of times to play the loop.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.lpNext
member.summary: Reserved. This member is used within the audio driver to maintain a first-in, first-out linked list of headers awaiting playback.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.reserved
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyContext
member.summary: Implements SIP 'proxy context'. Defined in RFC 3261.
member.remarks: Proxy context is bridge between caller and calee. Proxy context job is to forward request to contact(s) and send received responses back to caller.

member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: Server transaction what is used to send SIP responses back to caller.
If true, Record-Route header field will be added.
Specifies how proxy context must handle forking.
Specifies if proxy context is in B2BUA or just transaction satefull mode.
Specifies if proxy should not send Cancel to forked requests.
Specifies what proxy server does when it gets 3xx response. If true proxy will forward request to new specified address if false, proxy will return 3xx response to caller.
Possible remote targets. NOTE: These values must be in priority order !
member.exception: Is raised when any of the reference type prameters is null.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyContext.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans up any resources being used.

member.summary: Is called when server transaction has canceled.

member.summary: This method is called when server transaction has disposed.

member.summary: Starts processing.

Is raised when this method is called more than once.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyContext.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels proxy context processing. All client transactions and owner server transaction will be canceled, proxy context will be disposed.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and and this method is accessed.
Is raised when Start method is not called and this method is accessed.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Replaces
member.summary: Implements SIP "Replaces" value. Defined in RFC 3891.

remarks.code: RFC 3891 Syntax: Replaces = callid *(SEMI replaces-param) replaces-param = to-tag / from-tag / early-flag / generic-param to-tag = "to-tag" EQUAL token from-tag = "from-tag" EQUAL token early-flag = "early-only"

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ReasonValue
member.summary: Implements SIP "reason-value" value. Defined in rfc 3326.

remarks.code: RFC 3326 Syntax: reason-value = protocol *(SEMI reason-params) protocol = "SIP" / "Q.850" / token reason-params = protocol-cause / reason-text / reason-extension protocol-cause = "cause" EQUAL cause cause = 1*DIGIT reason-text = "text" EQUAL quoted-string reason-extension = generic-param

member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Coding method used in a MIME message body part.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentType

member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentBase
member.summary: Gets or sets base to be used for resolving relative URIs within this content part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Base to be used for resolving relative URIs within this content part. See also Content-Location.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets URI for retrieving a body part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: URI using which the content of this body-part part was retrieved, might be retrievable, or which otherwise gives a globally unique identification of the content.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.Contentfeatures
member.summary: Gets or sets content features of a MIME body part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: The 'Content-features:' header can be used to annotate a MIME body part with a media feature expression, to indicate features of the body part content. See also RFC 2533, RFC 2506, and RFC 2045.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets content disposition. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Indicates whether a MIME body part is to be shown inline or is an attachment; can also indicate a suggested filename for use when saving an attachment to a file.
member.exception: Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets language of message content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Can include a code for the natural language used in a message; e.g., 'en' for English. Can also contain a list of languages for a message containing more than one language.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentAlternative
member.summary: Gets or sets message alternative content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Information about the media features of alternative content formats available for the current message.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentMD5
member.summary: Gets or sets content MD5 checksum. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Checksum of content to ensure that it has not been modified.

member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.summary: Gets the SSRC identifier of the source to which the information in this reception report block pertains.

member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction of RTP data packets from source SSRC lost since the previous SR or RR packet was sent.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTCP_Packet_ReportBlock.CumulativePacketsLost
member.summary: Gets or sets total number of RTP data packets from source SSRC that have been lost since the beginning of reception.

member.summary: Gets or sets extended highest sequence number received.

member.summary: Gets or sets an estimate of the statistical variance of the RTP data packet interarrival time, measured in timestamp units and expressed as an unsigned integer.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTCP_Packet_ReportBlock.LastSR
member.summary: Gets or sets The middle 32 bits out of 64 in the NTP timestamp (as explained in Section 4) received as part of the most recent RTCP sender report (SR) packet from source SSRC_n. If no SR has been received yet, the field is set to zero.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTCP_Packet_ReportBlock.DelaySinceLastSR
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay, expressed in units of 1/65536 seconds, between receiving the last SR packet from source SSRC_n and sending this reception report block. If no SR packet has been received yet from SSRC_n, the DLSR field is set to zero.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ViaParm
member.summary: Implements SIP "via-parm" value. Defined in RFC 3261.

remarks.code:
RFC 3261 Syntax: via-parm = sent-protocol LWS sent-by *( SEMI via-params ) via-params = via-ttl / via-maddr / via-received / via-branch / via-extension via-ttl = "ttl" EQUAL ttl via-maddr = "maddr" EQUAL host via-received = "received" EQUAL (IPv4address / IPv6address) via-branch = "branch" EQUAL token via-extension = generic-param sent-protocol = protocol-name SLASH protocol-version SLASH transport protocol-name = "SIP" / token protocol-version = token transport = "UDP" / "TCP" / "TLS" / "SCTP" / other-transport sent-by = host [ COLON port ] ttl = 1*3DIGIT ; 0 to 255
Via extentions: // RFC 3486 via-compression = "comp" EQUAL ("sigcomp" / other-compression) // RFC 3581 response-port = "rport" [EQUAL 1*DIGIT]

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ViaParm.#ctor
member.summary: Defualt constructor.

member.summary: Creates new branch paramter value.

member.summary: Parses "via-parm" from specified value.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ViaParm.Parse(LumiSoft.Net.StringReader)
member.summary: Parses "via-parm" from specified reader.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.summary: Client transaction waits Start method to be called.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Calling
member.summary: Calling to recipient. This is used only by INVITE client transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Trying
member.summary: This is transaction initial state. Used only in Non-INVITE transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Proceeding
member.summary: This is INVITE server transaction initial state. Used only in INVITE server transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Accpeted
member.summary: INVITE transaction has sent or received 2xx response.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Completed
member.summary: Transaction has got final response.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Confirmed
member.summary: Transation has got ACK from request maker. This is used only by INVITE server transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Terminated
member.summary: Transaction has terminated and waits disposing.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Disposed
member.summary: Transaction has disposed.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.QuotedPrintableStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: Is raised when buffer is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.
Is raised when reading not supported.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.QuotedPrintableStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes a sequence of bytes, writes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: Is raised when buffer is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.
Is raised when reading not supported.

IMAP sequence-set. RFC 3501.
Examples: 2 -> seq-number (2) 2:4 -> seq-range (from 2 - 4) 2:* -> seq-range (from 2 to last) 2,3,10:* -> sequence-set (seq-number,seq-number,seq-range) (2,3, 10 - last)

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.MultiStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this method is accessed.

member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written. This method is not supported and always throws a NotSupportedException.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this method is accessed.
Is raised when this method is accessed.

member.summary: Queries a specified waveform device to determine its capabilities.

Size, in bytes, of the WAVEOUTCAPS structure.

member.summary: Get the waveInGetNumDevs function returns the number of waveform-audio input devices present in the system.
member.returns: Returns the waveInGetNumDevs function returns the number of waveform-audio input devices present in the system.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.waveInOpen(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX,LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.waveInProc,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The waveInOpen function opens the given waveform-audio input device for recording.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives a handle identifying the open waveform-audio input device.

Identifier of the waveform-audio input device to open. It can be either a device identifier or a handle of an open waveform-audio input device. You can use the following flag instead of a device identifier.
Pointer to a WAVEFORMATEX structure that identifies the desired format for recording waveform-audio data. You can free this structure immediately after waveInOpen returns.

Pointer to a fixed callback function, an event handle, a handle to a window, or the identifier of a thread to be called during waveform-audio recording to process messages related to the progress of recording. If no callback function is required, this value can be zero. For more information on the callback function, see waveInProc.
User-instance data passed to the callback mechanism.

member.summary: Prepares a waveform data block for recording.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio input device.
Pointer to a WAVEHDR structure that identifies the data block to be prepared. The buffer's base address must be aligned with the respect to the sample size.
Size, in bytes, of the WAVEHDR structure.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.wFormatTag
member.summary: Waveform-audio format type. Format tags are registered with Microsoft Corporation for many compression algorithms. A complete list of format tags can be found in the Mmreg.h header file. For one- or two-channel PCM data, this value should be WAVE_FORMAT_PCM. When this structure is included in a WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE structure, this value must be WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.nChannels
member.summary: Number of channels in the waveform-audio data. Monaural data uses one channel and stereo data uses two channels.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.nSamplesPerSec
member.summary: Sample rate, in samples per second (hertz). If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, then common values for nSamplesPerSec are 8.0 kHz, 11.025 kHz, 22.05 kHz, and 44.1 kHz.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.nAvgBytesPerSec
member.summary: Required average data-transfer rate, in bytes per second, for the format tag. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, nAvgBytesPerSec should be equal to the product of nSamplesPerSec and nBlockAlign.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.nBlockAlign
member.summary: Block alignment, in bytes. The block alignment is the minimum atomic unit of data for the wFormatTag format type. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM or WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE, nBlockAlign must be equal to the product of nChannels and wBitsPerSample divided by 8 (bits per byte).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.wBitsPerSample
member.summary: Bits per sample for the wFormatTag format type. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, then wBitsPerSample should be equal to 8 or 16.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.cbSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of extra format information appended to the end of the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.summary: Long pointer to the address of the waveform buffer.

member.summary: Specifies the length, in bytes, of the buffer.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEHDR.dwBytesRecorded
member.summary: When the header is used in input, this member specifies how much data is in the buffer. When the header is used in output, this member specifies the number of bytes played from the buffer.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioIn.WaveIn.WAVEHDR.lpNext
member.summary: Reserved. This member is used within the audio driver to maintain a first-in, first-out linked list of headers awaiting playback.

member.remarks: The character "*" is a wildcard, and matches zero or more characters at this position. The character "%" is similar to "*", but it does not match a hierarchy delimiter. member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6. Content-Transfer-Encoding. Specified how entity data is encoded.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum._7bit
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.7. 7bit data. "7bit data" refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences [RFC-821]. No octets with decimal values greater than 127 are allowed and neither are NULs (octets with decimal value 0). CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum._8bit
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.8. 8bit data. "8bit data" refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences [RFC-821]), but octets with decimal values greater than 127 may be used. As with "7bit data" CR and LF octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences and no NULs are allowed.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Binary
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.9. Binary data. "Binary data" refers to data where any sequence of octets whatsoever is allowed.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6.7 Quoted-Printable Content-Transfer-Encoding.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Base64
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6.8 Base64 Content-Transfer-Encoding.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.NotSpecified
member.summary: Content-Transfer-Encoding field isn't available(doesn't exist).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Unknown
member.summary: Content transfer encoding is unknown.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings
member.summary: This class holds MIME content transfer encodings. Defined in RFC 2045 6.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.SevenBit
member.summary: Up to 998 octets per line of the code range 1..127 with CR and LF (codes 13 and 10 respectively) only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending. This is the default value. Defined in RFC 2045 6.2.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.EightBit
member.summary: Up to 998 octets per line with CR and LF (codes 13 and 10 respectively) only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending. Defined in RFC 2045 6.2.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Used to encode arbitrary octet sequences into a form that satisfies the rules of 7bit. Designed to be efficient and mostly human readable when used for text data consisting primarily of US-ASCII characters but also containing a small proportion of bytes with values outside that range. Defined in RFC 2045 6.7.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.Base64
member.summary: Used to encode arbitrary octet sequences into a form that satisfies the rules of 7bit. Has a fixed overhead and is intended for non text data and text that is not ASCII heavy. Defined in RFC 2045 6.8.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.Binary
member.summary: Any sequence of octets. This type is not widely used. Defined in RFC 3030.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mail.Mail_h_Received
member.summary: Represents "Received:" header. Defined in RFC 5321 4.4.

remarks.code:
RFC 5321 4.4. Time-stamp-line = "Received:" FWS Stamp CRLF
Stamp = From-domain By-domain Opt-info [CFWS] ";" FWS date-time ; where "date-time" is as defined in RFC 5322 [4] ; but the "obs-" forms, especially two-digit ; years, are prohibited in SMTP and MUST NOT be used.
From-domain = "FROM" FWS Extended-Domain
By-domain = CFWS "BY" FWS Extended-Domain
Extended-Domain = Domain / ( Domain FWS "(" TCP-info ")" ) / ( address-literal FWS "(" TCP-info ")" )
TCP-info = address-literal / ( Domain FWS address-literal ) ; Information derived by server from TCP connection not client EHLO.
Opt-info = [Via] [With] [ID] [For] [Additional-Registered-Clauses]
Via = CFWS "VIA" FWS Link
With = CFWS "WITH" FWS Protocol
ID = CFWS "ID" FWS ( Atom / msg-id ) ; msg-id is defined in RFC 5322 [4]
For = CFWS "FOR" FWS ( Path / Mailbox )
Additional-Registered-Clauses = CFWS Atom FWS String
Link = "TCP" / Addtl-Link
Addtl-Link = Atom
Protocol = "ESMTP" / "SMTP" / Attdl-Protocol
Mailbox = Local-part "@" ( Domain / address-literal )

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Mail.Mail_h_Received.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: Host from where message was received.
Date time when message was received.
member.exception: Is raised when from or by is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

member.summary: Parses header field from the specified value.
member.param: Header field value. Header field name must be included. For example: 'Sender: john.doe@domain.com'.
member.exception: Is raised when value is null reference.
Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.summary: Returns header field as string.
member.param: 8-bit words ecnoder. Value null means that words are not encoded.
Charset to use to encode 8-bit characters. Value null means parameters not encoded.
If true always specified encoding is used. If false and header field value not modified, original encoding is kept.

member.summary: Get the waveInGetNumDevs function returns the number of waveform-audio input devices present in the system.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.waveInOpen(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX,LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.waveInProc,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The waveInOpen function opens the given waveform-audio input device for recording.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives a handle identifying the open waveform-audio input device.

Identifier of the waveform-audio input device to open. It can be either a device identifier or a handle of an open waveform-audio input device. You can use the following flag instead of a device identifier.
Pointer to a WAVEFORMATEX structure that identifies the desired format for recording waveform-audio data. You can free this structure immediately after waveInOpen returns.

Pointer to a fixed callback function, an event handle, a handle to a window, or the identifier of a thread to be called during waveform-audio recording to process messages related to the progress of recording. If no callback function is required, this value can be zero. For more information on the callback function, see waveInProc.
User-instance data passed to the callback mechanism.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.waveInPrepareHeader(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Prepares a waveform data block for recording.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio input device.
Pointer to a WAVEHDR structure that identifies the data block to be prepared. The buffer's base address must be aligned with the respect to the sample size.
Size, in bytes, of the WAVEHDR structure.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WavConstants
member.summary: This class provides most used wav constants.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX
member.summary: This class represents WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.wFormatTag
member.summary: Waveform-audio format type. Format tags are registered with Microsoft Corporation for many compression algorithms. A complete list of format tags can be found in the Mmreg.h header file. For one- or two-channel PCM data, this value should be WAVE_FORMAT_PCM. When this structure is included in a WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE structure, this value must be WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.nChannels
member.summary: Number of channels in the waveform-audio data. Monaural data uses one channel and stereo data uses two channels.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.nSamplesPerSec
member.summary: Sample rate, in samples per second (hertz). If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, then common values for nSamplesPerSec are 8.0 kHz, 11.025 kHz, 22.05 kHz, and 44.1 kHz.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.nAvgBytesPerSec
member.summary: Required average data-transfer rate, in bytes per second, for the format tag. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, nAvgBytesPerSec should be equal to the product of nSamplesPerSec and nBlockAlign.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.nBlockAlign
member.summary: Block alignment, in bytes. The block alignment is the minimum atomic unit of data for the wFormatTag format type. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM or WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE, nBlockAlign must be equal to the product of nChannels and wBitsPerSample divided by 8 (bits per byte).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.wBitsPerSample
member.summary: Bits per sample for the wFormatTag format type. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, then wBitsPerSample should be equal to 8 or 16.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEFORMATEX.cbSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of extra format information appended to the end of the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEOUTCAPS

member.summary: Version number of the device driver for the device.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEOUTCAPS.szPname
member.summary: Product name in a null-terminated string.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEOUTCAPS.dwFormats
member.summary: Standard formats that are supported.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEOUTCAPS.wChannels
member.summary: Number specifying whether the device supports mono (1) or stereo (2) output.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEOUTCAPS.wReserved1
member.summary: Packing.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media._WaveIn.WAVEOUTCAPS.dwSupport
member.summary: Optional functionality supported by the device.

member.summary: When the header is used in input, this member specifies how much data is in the buffer. When the header is used in output, this member specifies the number of bytes played from the buffer.

member.summary: Gets or sets 'delay' prameter value. Value -1 means not specified. Specifies a delay interval between announcement repetitions. The delay is measured in milliseconds. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets 'duration' prameter value. Value -1 means not specified. Specifies the maximum duration of the announcement. The media server will discontinue the announcement and end the call if the maximum duration has been reached. The duration is measured in milliseconds. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Locale
member.summary: Gets or sets 'locale' prameter value. Specifies the language and optionally country variant of the announcement sequence named in the "play=" parameter. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Lr
member.summary: Gets or sets 'lr' parameter. The lr parameter, when present, indicates that the element responsible for this resource implements the routing mechanisms specified in this document. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Maddr
member.summary: Gets or sets 'maddr' parameter value. Value null means not specified. NOTE: This value is deprecated in since SIP 2.0. The maddr parameter indicates the server address to be contacted for this user, overriding any address derived from the host field. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Method
member.summary: Gets or sets 'method' prameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Play
member.summary: Gets or sets 'play' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Specifies the resource or announcement sequence to be played. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Repeat
member.summary: Gets or sets 'repeat' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified, value int.MaxValue means 'forever'. Specifies how many times the media server should repeat the announcement or sequence named by the "play=" parameter. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Target
member.summary: Gets or sets 'target' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Transport
member.summary: Gets or sets 'transport' parameter value. Value null means not specified. The transport parameter determines the transport mechanism to be used for sending SIP messages. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Ttl
member.summary: Gets or sets 'ttl' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified. NOTE: This value is deprecated in since SIP 2.0. The ttl parameter determines the time-to-live value of the UDP multicast packet and MUST only be used if maddr is a multicast address and the transport protocol is UDP. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_User
member.summary: Gets or sets 'user' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Voicexml
member.summary: Gets or sets 'voicexml' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets header.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes
member.summary: This class holds SIP respnse codes.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x100_Trying
member.summary: This response indicates that the request has been received by the next-hop server and that some unspecified action is being taken on behalf of this call (for example, a database is being consulted).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x180_Ringing
member.summary: The UA receiving the INVITE is trying to alert the user.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x181_Call_Forwarded
member.summary: A server MAY use this status code to indicate that the call is being forwarded to a different set of destinations.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x182_Queued
member.summary: The called party is temporarily unavailable, but the server has decided to queue the call rather than reject it. When the callee becomes available, it will return the appropriate final status response.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x183_Session_Progress
member.summary: The 183 (Session Progress) response is used to convey information about the progress of the call that is not otherwise classified.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x200_Ok
member.summary: The request has succeeded.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x202_Ok
member.summary: The request has accepted. Defined in rfc 3265.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x301_Ok
member.summary: The user can no longer be found at the address in the Request-URI, and the requesting client SHOULD retry at the new address given by the Contact header field (Section 20.10). Defined in rfc 3265.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x302_Ok
member.summary: The requesting client SHOULD retry the request at the new address(es) given by the Contact header field (Section 20.10). Defined in rfc 3265.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x400_Bad_Request
member.summary: The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax. The Reason-Phrase SHOULD identify the syntax problem in more detail, for example, "Missing Call-ID header field".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x401_Unauthorized
member.summary: The request requires user authentication.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x403_Forbidden
member.summary: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it. Authorization will not help, and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x404_Not_Found
member.summary: The server has definitive information that the user does not exist at the domain specified in the Request-URI.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x405_Method_Not_Allowed
member.summary: The method specified in the Request-Line is understood, but not allowed for the address identified by the Request-URI.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x406_Not_Acceptable
member.summary: The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities that have content characteristics not acceptable according to the Accept header field sent in the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x407_Proxy_Authentication_Required
member.summary: This code is similar to 401 (Unauthorized), but indicates that the client MUST first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x408_Request_Timeout
member.summary: The server could not produce a response within a suitable amount of time, for example, if it could not determine the location of the user in time.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x410_Gone
member.summary: The requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known. This condition is expected to be considered permanent.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x412_Conditional_Request_Failed
member.summary: Is used to indicate that the precondition given for the request has failed. Defined in rfc 3903.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x413_Request_Entity_Too_Large
member.summary: The server is refusing to process a request because the request entity-body is larger than the server is willing or able to process. The server MAY close the connection to prevent the client from continuing the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x414_RequestURI_Too_Long
member.summary: The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x415_Unsupported_Media_Type
member.summary: The server is refusing to service the request because the message body of the request is in a format not supported by the server for the requested method. The server MUST return a list of acceptable formats using the Accept, Accept-Encoding, or Accept-Language header field, depending on the specific problem with the content.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x416_Unsupported_URI_Scheme
member.summary: The server cannot process the request because the scheme of the URI in the Request-URI is unknown to the server.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x417_Unknown_Resource_Priority
member.summary: TODO: add description. Defined in rfc 4412.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x420_Bad_Extension
member.summary: The server did not understand the protocol extension specified in a Proxy-Require or Require header field.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x421_Extension_Required
member.summary: The UAS needs a particular extension to process the request, but this extension is not listed in a Supported header field in the request. Responses with this status code MUST contain a Require header field listing the required extensions.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x422_Session_Interval_Too_Small
member.summary: It is generated by a UAS or proxy when a request contains a Session-Expires header field with a duration below the minimum timer for the server. The 422 response MUST contain a Min-SE header field with the minimum timer for that server.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x423_Interval_Too_Brief
member.summary: The server is rejecting the request because the expiration time of the resource refreshed by the request is too short. This response can be used by a registrar to reject a registration whose Contact header field expiration time was too small.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x428_Use_Identity_Header
member.summary: It is used when the verifier receives a message with an Identity signature that does not correspond to the digest-string calculated by the verifier. Defined in rfc 4474.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x429_Provide_Referrer_Identity
member.summary: TODO: add description. Defined in rfc 3892.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x436_Bad_Identity_Info
member.summary: It is used when the Identity-Info header contains a URI that cannot be dereferenced by the verifier (either the URI scheme is unsupported by the verifier, or the resource designated by the URI is otherwise unavailable). Defined in rfc 4474.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x437_Unsupported_Certificate
member.summary: It is used when the verifier cannot validate the certificate referenced by the URI of the Identity-Info header, because, for example, the certificate is self-signed, or signed by a root certificate authority for whom the verifier does not possess a root certificate. Defined in rfc 4474.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x438_Invalid_Identity_Header
member.summary: It is used when the verifier receives a message with an Identity signature that does not correspond to the digest-string calculated by the verifier. Defined in rfc 4474.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x480_Temporarily_Unavailable
member.summary: The callee's end system was contacted successfully but the callee is currently unavailable (for example, is not logged in, logged in but in a state that precludes communication with the callee, or has activated the "do not disturb" feature).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x481_Call_Transaction_Does_Not_Exist
member.summary: This status indicates that the UAS received a request that does not match any existing dialog or transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x482_Loop_Detected
member.summary: The server has detected a loop.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x483_Too_Many_Hops
member.summary: The server received a request that contains a Max-Forwards.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x484_Address_Incomplete
member.summary: The server received a request with a Request-URI that was incomplete. Additional information SHOULD be provided in the reason phrase.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x485_Ambiguous
member.summary: The Request-URI was ambiguous.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x486_Busy_Here
member.summary: The callee's end system was contacted successfully, but the callee is currently not willing or able to take additional calls at this end system. The response MAY indicate a better time to call in the Retry-After header field.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x487_Request_Terminated
member.summary: The request was terminated by a BYE or CANCEL request. This response is never returned for a CANCEL request itself.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x488_Not_Acceptable_Here
member.summary: The response has the same meaning as 606 (Not Acceptable), but only applies to the specific resource addressed by the Request-URI and the request may succeed elsewhere.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x489_Bad_Event
member.summary: Is used to indicate that the server did not understand the event package specified in a "Event" header field. Defined in rfc 3265.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x491_Request_Pending
member.summary: The request was received by a UAS that had a pending request within the same dialog.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x493_Undecipherable
member.summary: The request was received by a UAS that contained an encrypted MIME body for which the recipient does not possess or will not provide an appropriate decryption key.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x494_Security_Agreement_Required
member.summary: TODO: add description. Defined in rfc 3329.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x500_Server_Internal_Error
member.summary: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x501_Not_Implemented
member.summary: The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x502_Bad_Gateway
member.summary: The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from the downstream server it accessed in attempting to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x503_Service_Unavailable
member.summary: The server is temporarily unable to process the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x504_Timeout
member.summary: The server did not receive a timely response from an external server it accessed in attempting to process the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x504_Version_Not_Supported
member.summary: The server does not support, or refuses to support, the SIP protocol version that was used in the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x513_Message_Too_Large
member.summary: The server was unable to process the request since the message length exceeded its capabilities.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x580_Precondition_Failure
member.summary: When a UAS, acting as an answerer, cannot or is not willing to meet the preconditions in the offer. Defined in rfc 3312.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x600_Busy_Everywhere
member.summary: The callee's end system was contacted successfully but the callee is busy and does not wish to take the call at this time.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x603_Decline
member.summary: The callee's machine was successfully contacted but the user explicitly does not wish to or cannot participate.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x604_Does_Not_Exist_Anywhere
member.summary: The server has authoritative information that the user indicated in the Request-URI does not exist anywhere

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x606_Not_Acceptable
member.summary: The user's agent was contacted successfully but some aspects of the session description such as the requested media, bandwidth, or addressing style were not acceptable.

member.summary: Implements SIP "language-tag" value. Defined in RFC 3261.
